→ Maternal health bill passes the House
→ Helping residents receive their unemployment benefits
→ Fighting against breast cancer
…& more in my recent newsletter, here: https://t.co/jUPjxeoPBt
Sign up to receive updates: https://t.co/mmhKWdTe96 https://t.co/50ubBnFes5

I’m pleased the House recently passed another piece of legislation I’m helping lead in Congress, which is going to help protect women’s and mom’s health in Southwest Washington. Read more on this legislation ⬇️ https://t.co/z3EOAt2wqx

I’m pleased to partner with @RepKatiePorter on this bipartisan legislation to ensure new parents will have the flexibility to enroll their infant in health insurance & focus on what's most important – the health & wellbeing of the mom & their new child. ➡️ https://t.co/RMhCS8X7TJ https://t.co/rvAQFYY4Jv

I’m pleased the House passed a bill I’m helping lead which will increase access to health services for women in rural areas, expand telehealth, & improve the quality of care & training for maternal health providers.

Read more on this important bill ➡️ https://t.co/vwqUmTwrmZ https://t.co/v3MYtssZBZ

Assisting Southwest Washington folks through this public health crisis continues to be my number one priority. 

Recently, I was able to help a resident from Camas receive her unemployment benefits from Oregon ― Watch ⬇️

Call: (360) 695-6292
Message: https://t.co/fT0temclXO https://t.co/Vax9XW9tmg

The impacts of youth substance use are felt far & wide in our communities, which is why I was honored to help secure  critical funds now being directed here in Southwest Washington to help our young adults lead healthy and fulfilling lives.
https://t.co/51jlj6HlI4

I’m continuing to fight to protect maternal health in Southwest Washington, and one of those steps is ensuring that pregnant workers receive reasonable accommodations to have safe and healthy pregnancies. Read more ⬇️
https://t.co/sL2DSWFgZk
With almost two dozen Democrats signaling this week they will sign my petition if no bipartisan COVID package is produced, I’m going to keep the pressure going on this effort. Stay tuned. (2/2)
RT @RepRobinKelly: Today, the House passed my bipartisan #HelpingMOMS Act (#HR4996) to increase access to healthcare coverage for new moms.…

I have good news on a bill I'm leading in Congress (which passed the House today!) to help pregnant workers in Southwest Washington have safe and healthy pregnancies. 

Watch ⬇️ 

More info on this critical legislation: https://t.co/kJEoLVyWx1 https://t.co/nwm2nan6qY
RT @ClarkCoWA_PH: Air quality is unhealthy across Clark County this morning. Everyone, especially sensitive groups, should limit time outdo…

As mentors, parents, & friends it’s our duty to help lead young adults on the path to living healthy lives. 

In SW WA we have several programs to help fight against youth substance use & I was pleased to help secure federal funds for these vital programs.
https://t.co/nSkgtV04Kh

I’ve supported efforts to strengthen the USPS in Congress, such as advocating for six-day delivery and providing USPS with emergency resources to operate during COVID-19 – and folks here don’t want to see those efforts undermined. (2/2) https://t.co/HBCJKClYR7

I worked to implement the Paycheck Protection Program because our rural hospitals on the coast & hundreds of other businesses in the region needed this lifeline. Over 2,500 jobs saved & $19M in forgivable loans secured by Pacific Co. small businesses. https://t.co/EsQhPpQlN1
I'm also continuing to add small business resources, Social Security information, unemployment benefits, and more on my COVID-dedicated webpage, here ⬇️ https://t.co/zAj6ohzhMA

Visited the just-launched Talking Cedar Distillery today! Hopefully we can continue resuming normal activities in the coming weeks, & I’m wearing a mask to reduce risk for my own family & community. https://t.co/TVvH0B9Eby

We all want life to return to normal. However, many individuals & small businesses continue to need assistance right now, so I'm updating my COVID-dedicated page with links, helpful resources & more to help folks weather this challenging time. 

➡️ https://t.co/zAj6ohzhMA https://t.co/Tj59DgL0Mp

PPE continues to be a critical need for our frontline healthcare workers. Which is why @RepJayapal and I are leading a bipartisan request asking the president to invoke the Defense Production Act to help increase production of PPE.

Read our full letter ↓ https://t.co/zueL0I4LEU

This is unacceptable – residents are facing an economic crisis & the assistance Congress put in place isn’t getting to them. My WA congressional colleagues, @RepNewhouse, @cathymcmorris & I have heard from thousands of residents who’ve gone weeks & in some cases months . .  (1/2)

In light of the challenges we currently face as a nation – a public health crisis, calls for justice and equality, millions facing economic hardship – we need to coalesce around ideas and policies that will lift folks up and heal our communities. (2/3)

. . . to each and every one of the folks who have had their livelihoods disrupted by COVID. The Washington State Employment Security Department needs to produce an action plan to solve this significant issue – quickly. (2/2)
For other COVID-related assistance for Southwest Washington farmers and food producers, please visit: https://t.co/LL27akTqKk

Important COVID-19 assistance update: The @USDA's Coronavirus Food Assistance Program begins today. The CFAP will provide direct relief to farmers & ranchers who faced price declines & additional marketing costs due to COVID-19. 

More info here: https://t.co/uYW1La0nNF

Transit is a lifeline for folks in Longview & Kelso, but it’s important that riders’ safety & health are a high priority. I was pleased to help secure this funding to enhance the well-being of seniors, workers & others who rely on public transportation. 
https://t.co/uu6hNtNnlC

Testing remains a critical tool to help us return to normal life and protect seniors, workers and residents. 

I was pleased to help secure additional funding to increase testing capacity in Southwest Washington – read about this important funding here ⬇️
https://t.co/wLnEA6TQC6

We want to see our SW WA businesses reopen their doors. Until they do, I'm ensuring they have the assistance and tools to weather this storm. I've provided comprehensive info on small business assistance on my COVID-resource page, here ➡️ https://t.co/zAj6ohzhMA https://t.co/zRvJ0RshY4
Thank you to our front-line health care workers, first responders, and especially our nurses during #NationalNursesWeek https://t.co/zRL0DFPMMi
Today’s hearing focused on COVID-19 – giving me the opportunity to discuss securing our manufacturing chain, protecting senior living facilities & other vulnerable residents. https://t.co/uy7NzABdgn
I’ll keep working both at home & here in the capital on pinpointing the most effective ways to combat this virus & get our economies in SW WA reopened.

In D.C. today, my colleagues & I on the health-focused subcommittee heard experts weigh in specifically on supply chain improvements, protecting vulnerable populations & other critical COVID-19 issues. https://t.co/dahsB4MHEA

I’m encouraged Congress passed & the president signed into law the bill to replenish the #PaycheckProtectionProgram for our small businesses, as well as provide more support for our hospitals & increase testing for our communities. https://t.co/l75Jkm00Ji

I voted in favor of additional funding for the #PaycheckProtectionProgram for SW WA businesses, relief for our hospitals & expanded testing for our communities. 

The president is expected to sign the bill & I'll push to get these funds out to businesses as soon as possible. https://t.co/BeJ1z8qg82

We sent a letter to @GovInslee to consider implementing this effort here by utilizing rapid testing being developed by Vancouver’s @mtl_social and starting with an industry here like residential construction.

To reopen our economy & get folks back to work, we must increase access to rapid & widespread testing. 

I've joined Vancouver Mayor McEnerny-Ogle, in proposing a back-to-work demonstration project in SW WA that could provide a blueprint for reopening segments of WA's economy.

Our small businesses in SW WA must have the support to weather the COVID-19 crisis. 

This means ensuring the Paycheck Protection Program has adequate funds to help employers keep their businesses afloat, as well as continuing to support hard-working families.
(1/3) Small businesses have been hit hard by COVID-19, and we must work overtime to ensure they have relief.  We also need to empower them to preserve as many of the jobs they provide as possible.
My thanks go to all our health workers endeavoring to identify cases and take protective measures. I’ll keep taking steps to get both those in cities and in rural communities the tools they need.

Testing remains key. Today I joined my WA state Republican & Democrat colleagues in requesting FEMA & the Dept. of Health & Human Services to ship additional COVID-19 sample testing kits to WA state. 

Read our full letter ⬇️ https://t.co/K2wJaTaMVV

I'm making my website a one-stop shop for small business help, unemployment assistance & other resources to help get folks through this time. (Thanks to my little helper on this announcement...😊) 

Hope you and yours are staying safe & healthy! https://t.co/fMEgS2bS8p

Attention seniors receiving Social Security: you will NOT be required to file a tax return before receiving your COVID-19 economic payment, even if you didn’t file a tax return for 2019 or 2018.  https://t.co/cOsO0e3MGx

Reminder: I am hosting a Tele-Town Hall today, April 1 @ 5:30pm PST. We will have experts on hand to discuss public health info, economic assistance for impacted workers & support for small businesses during COVID-19.

CALL: 1-877-229-8493
PASSCODE: 116365

Looking forward to speaking with you this Wednesday with our experts who will provide info on public health & economic assistance for impacted workers & small businesses during COVID-19. https://t.co/iTfzkq2mDU

On this #NationalDoctorsDay, I want to thank all the doctors – and health care workers – who are working on the frontlines to keep our families and communities safe and healthy during this difficult time. https://t.co/ihZouVDWAP
RT @CDCgov: Take simple daily precautions to help prevent the spread of respiratory illnesses like #COVID19. Learn how to protect yourself…

COVID-19 relief update: The House unanimously passed the CARES Act, which will provide emergency relief for workers, families, and small businesses throughout Southwest Washington.

To our Southwest Washington front line responders serving during this pandemic — thank you. https://t.co/VHYE5QJv5M

I’m encouraged the Senate has finalized the next COVID-19 relief package to bring much-needed assistance to our SW WA communities. 

We need to get it passed & signed into law to get this assistance into our homes, businesses & hospitals – now. https://t.co/SiT6E0OqHE

The small business disaster loan program is vital, but I'm hearing loud & clear from restaurants, shops & other small employers that more is needed.

I joined with @RepDerekKilmer in formally pushing additional economic relief for small businesses in the next COVID-19 package. https://t.co/hwYIUZ7g6h

There is a blood shortage nationwide & if you are healthy & able to donate blood, please consider doing so. 

We can continue to combat COVID-19 & its effect while also giving back to our communities – this is a great way. https://t.co/Rymcxrf4dA

I support @GovInslee’s request to the administration for a major disaster declaration for WA. Folks across our state & in SW WA have been deeply impacted by COVID-19 – underscoring the necessity of declaring a major disaster that will bring relief to our communities & families.

I’ve added new info to my COVID-19 resource page ➡️ https://t.co/zAj6ohzhMA.

It includes info on small business disaster loan assistance, contact info for local public health departments, steps Congress is taking to combat the effects of the virus & other resources. https://t.co/E8FvSN4IiA

This crucial bill will provide support for Southwest Washington workers and small businesses through paid leave, ensure free COVID-19 testing and provide nutritional support for our seniors and children.
COVID-19 relief update from Congress ➡️ the Senate passed the House’s part 2 coronavirus relief package that is now on the way to the president’s desk to be signed into law.

My colleagues & I in the WA congressional delegation are pushing for increased economic assistance in the next COVID-19 emergency package. We’re asking for more small business relief & resources, emergency housing help, & assistance for tribes – all beneficial to those in SW WA. https://t.co/8qfuJVXHjh
I had a productive day meeting with local health stakeholders here in Southwest Washington who are working to help us confront COVID-19 with therapy and testing solutions. https://t.co/bj46WwxI7o

Passcode: 116365
Looking forward to speaking with you tomorrow, along with our special guest, Dr. Alan Melnick, who will help provide useful information regarding the novel coronavirus. https://t.co/icUtrwNmW4

I will continue to work with my colleagues on solutions to help combat this pandemic and protect folks throughout Southwest Washington.
This legislation is expected to pass the senate and the president has already signaled he’ll sign it. It includes improved testing access, family & sick leave & tax credits for small businesses.

COVID-19 update from Congress: the House just passed a bipartisan coronavirus relief bill that will assure our Southwest Washington communities, families and small businesses receive the resources they need during this difficult situation.

Attn SW WA residents: I will be hosting a Tele-Town Hall on Monday, March 16 @ 5:25pm PST w/special guest, Clark Co. Public Health Officer Dr. Alan Melnick, who will provide info about preventing the spread of the novel coronavirus & more.

SW WA citizens are already feeling the impact of the outbreak of the novel coronavirus - This is why I introduced two bipartisan bills to offer emergency support to those who need nutrition & unemployment assistance & other crisis management tools. https://t.co/XSaTEoAum4

Due to the ongoing novel coronavirus health crisis, several tours in D.C. (White House, Capitol Building) have been suspended until April 1st.

If you have any questions about cancelled tours in D.C., please contact my office @ 202-225-3536 & stay tuned for additional updates.

The CDC is sending $11M to WA state to fight the novel coronavirus, ensure access of test kits, set up of quarantine units & transportation of individuals to quarantine locations. I worked to secure this funding for our SW WA communities already impacted.

That’s why I introduced the Cure the Coronavirus Act, that would authorize the FDA to speed up review of drugs that prevent or treat COVID-19. https://t.co/Ony5jjaV6m

I remain ready to help in any way I can and will remain vigilant in ending the spread of this virus. (2/2)

With @VP Pence, @GovInslee, my WA state US House colleagues & other officials in discussing the outbreak of the novel coronavirus. It was encouraging to see the hard work the men & women who are fighting this are putting in at the WA State Emergency Operations Center. (1/2) https://t.co/ImjCPxqJ2Y
Thanks to the men & women fighting this on the front lines! I remain ready to provide the necessary support to keep Southwest Washington as safe and healthy as possible. (2/2) https://t.co/87Ei73K8Ou

Good visit at Camp Murray, WA to see the setup the Emergency Operations Team has in place to fight the novel coronavirus.

(2/2) Action is needed to ensure we don't have medication shortages down the line.

I sent a letter to Vice President Pence as the head of the U.S. response to the novel coronavirus on this and other important efforts. Read more: https://t.co/HhUJcZ10Zf https://t.co/irntkdiOaZ

(1/2) About 80% of the ingredients in our medications come from overseas, including many from China. The novel coronavirus is causing major issues for China in its efforts to keep people on the assembly lines & maintain manufacturing output.
Quick update on my meeting with a bipartisan group of members & Vice President Pence concerning the novel coronavirus. Take a look ⬇️ https://t.co/Kfh9Z6KmAj

(3/3) Furthermore, we will be infinitely more effective in containing and preventing the spread of the novel coronavirus in this nation if we work in a cooperative, bipartisan fashion and focus on solutions.
(2/3) This bill will prioritize the review of newly developed treatments for COVID-19. We should not let bureaucratic red tape get in the way of viable treatments.

(1/3) With the increase in novel coronavirus cases in WA & around the U.S., we must act quickly to stop the spread and pursue a cure, which is why I joined with my colleagues in introducing the bipartisan Cure the Coronavirus Act. 
https://t.co/U0FaYhEYbM

We are all becoming increasingly aware of the impact the novel coronavirus could have here in WA & the more information folks have access to, the better. 

Please visit the CDC’s website for more info & how to protect you & your family from this virus ⬇️ https://t.co/rvhqWqd0Z8

Thanks to the volunteers & residents who attended our Tax Prep Workshop in Ilwaco! Filing & preparing taxes can be confusing, so I was happy to offer folks this resource. 

I was also able to tour the Columbia Pacific Heritage Museum, which showcases some amazing SW WA history! https://t.co/iDRzq0W9Ht

Great to meet with @ChrisEvans & @MarkKassen to discuss the launch of #AStartingPoint – a bipartisan platform to educate citizens on the big issues. We chatted about lowering Rx drugs, maternal mortality & combatting the opioid epidemic. Thanks for having me, Captain America! 💪🏼 https://t.co/AJyxqB0L0H

Women in rural areas need access to better health care services. Pleased two important bills critical to helping protect moms are advancing in Congress. 

Read more ⬇️ https://t.co/jI0qn2lDYi

Happy New Year, Southwest Washington! 🎉

Wishing you and your loved ones a wonderful, healthy and blessed 2020.

As part of a bill to raise pay for our troops, my legislation – the Reserve Medical Office Parity Act – was just approved by the House. 

My bill will help provide health services to troops by increasing the number of available doctors & surgeons ⬇️ https://t.co/P9OQ4D87yy

Celebrating #RuralHealthDay by being a cosponsor of legislation like the Rural Health Clinic Modernization Act, which improves health care & services to Rural Health Clinics so folks in Morton, Bingen, and other small towns in SW WA have access to high quality health care. https://t.co/Wncuc29Mf0

Two bills I'm supporting, the Maternal Health Quality Improvement Act & the Helping MOMS Act, passed through @HouseCommerce this week! 

Read how these bipartisan bills are addressing issues like telehealth & reducing maternal mortality for minority women⬇️https://t.co/juITumyoE0

I hosted doctors, state health officials & medical professionals recently at The Vancouver Clinic to discuss the crisis of maternal mortality here in our community. 

Thanks for sharing valuable insight as we work to keep women in WA safe during pregnancy, childbirth & postpartum https://t.co/FfJrwwDLh1

¡Buenos días! Thank you @TweetHCN for the opportunity to share my work to improve life for the amazing Hispanic families I serve in SW WA. Access to affordable health care & good-paying jobs are my top priorities & I remain committed to helping every Hispanic family achieve them. https://t.co/txFOLjioFY

Helping young men & women lead healthier lifestyles includes preventing substance use. Addressing this issue has been a priority of mine in Congress & I’m pleased to have secured funding that supports 7 coalitions in SW WA to prevent youth substance use ⬇️ https://t.co/gQtflelCjU

✅ Working to reduce pregnancy loss

Powerful testimony today at @PeaceHealthSJMC in Longview from community leaders, doctors, & law enforcement on the scourge of opioid addiction in Cowlitz County. 

It was great to hear directly from those folks on the front lines fighting the battle of substance abuse. https://t.co/TgPuhUdACe

After all the sacrifices our veterans have made, we owe it to them to provide the best health services & resources available. It was great to have @DrPhilRoe from Tennessee in Chehalis with me to hear from local veterans about what's working & what isn't. https://t.co/MCsBPjSexQ
(1/2) I’ve worked to protect our endangered species - from promoting a healthy @GPNF, to boosting native salmon runs and finding solutions that preserve endangered species.

From my role on the Appropriations Committee in Congress, I fought for & helped secure federal dollars to combat the opioid epidemic. 

In WA state, $21.5 million has been allocated to fight the scourge of opioid addiction. 

Read more ↓ https://t.co/EwIARQcWTQ

I’m so pleased the CDC awarded its 1st round of funding to allow my #PreventingMaternalDeathsAct to take effect. In Washington alone, $375,000 has been granted to combat maternal mortality.
 
Read more ↓https://t.co/k1VUDB1KRu

As co-founders of the Maternity Care Caucus, @RepRoybalAllard and I had the opportunity today to testify about our priorities for improving health care for moms and babies. 

We have some exciting initiatives in the works! https://t.co/yVNHMiTGUK
RT @suzymidwife: Not a partisan issue.  It's a public health emergency & we all need to address it. Thanks Rep @HerreraBeutler for this tim…

Protecting vital medical coverage and lowering health care costs for hardworking families in Southwest Washington have been two of my top priorities in Congress. https://t.co/ukjUYggWd3
Widely-bipartisan support to repeal the “Cadillac tax” – a health care tax on working families – just now in the U.S. House. Read more: https://t.co/lRVFR65vZy

Such an honor to be awarded the “Champion for Children’s Health” award for my work to get #ACEKidsAct signed into law. This is one of my proudest efforts because it shows that we can accomplish hard stuff on behalf of vulnerable kids and families. https://t.co/pgyVsqx7ac

I’m one of a few – but growing – number of moms w/ young kids in Congress. I’ve talked to countless moms who, like me, have experienced maternal health challenges. I’m bringing these stories to the table as we seek an end to the #maternalmortality crisis. 
https://t.co/HvEMofFwOp

It is heartbreaking to see so many veterans facing homelessness and mental health crises in SW WA. 

The VA must follow the directive set forth by Congress to expand access to lifesaving resources for the men and women who served our country. https://t.co/awuHzPReeU

Our little girl, Isana Mae Beutler, was born Tuesday morning. It made me smile when I realized that Isana, which means strong-willed woman, was born on the Women’s Suffrage Centennial. We’re healthy and doing well. Abigail & Ethan are over the moon. https://t.co/VqdoBalDYC

In an era where so many solutions get caught in partisan gridlock, this is proof lawmakers from both sides of the aisle can work to improve health care for some of our most vulnerable. #ACEKidsAct

Read my latest in @seattletimes @SeaTimesOpinion 

https://t.co/rIwhEoYuzW
...expanded mental health telemedicine, and other critical resources for those in crisis. #MentalHealthAwarenessMonth #MentalHealthAwareness https://t.co/ACnee63XFq

From children and teens, to postpartum moms and retirees – we must care for those struggling with mental health conditions. 

From my role on @HouseAppropsGOP I’m working to ensure funding continues for pediatric mental health grants, the suicide lifeline, school counselors...
We have to take action to protect Pacific County jobs and families dependent on a healthy shellfish industry. https://t.co/UEa7wHeBty

Ocean acidification is a rising threat to shellfish & fishing industry jobs in Pacific Co, as well as the health of our ocean’s ecosystem. Pleased my bipartisan bill advanced through @housesciencegop yesterday & is now ready for a full U.S. House vote. https://t.co/fEERwiBeoX

Exciting development for my bipartisan bill to fight ocean acidification - it's markup day @housesciencegop I’ll be testifying in support of this bill that promotes solutions to secure a healthy shellfish and fishing industry for Pacific County. https://t.co/2XpYOhoRnV https://t.co/JsrSh6BGe4
This health care solution to benefit low-income children has been a long time coming, and I couldn’t be more proud to finally have #ACEKidsAct signed into law. https://t.co/teV2pY27Om

Our coastal communities depend on a healthy shellfish & fishing industry. Ocean acidification threatens jobs & the health of the ocean’s ecosystem. We’re offering this bipartisan bill to help us better understand the problem & find solutions. https://t.co/DOfANFg3PC

To all our law enforcement, thank you for keeping our communities safe! It was great to catch up with Lewis Co. Sheriff @RobSnaza & Morton Police Chief Morningstar and hear about their work to combat drug trafficking & provide mental health resources in our schools. https://t.co/dOW7JkgGKU

Whether we’re fighting for access to health care for low-income kids or working on legislation to rapidly respond to opioid overdoses, moms offer a unique, and needed, voice in Congress. https://t.co/mIq5HFF6SX

It was great to stop by Ocean Beach Hospital last week to present them with a flag flown over the U.S. Capitol and hear about the plans for a new clinic in Naselle. Our Critical Access Hospitals are such an important part of our rural communities. https://t.co/hlaeX1JdlR

A health crisis of this magnitude demands immediate action at the highest levels of government — or so you’d think. But before I was elected to Congress, there were no federal efforts to address the #maternalmortality epidemic. https://t.co/4R9F9H9RxG

There are over 1,800 Washingtonians on the wait list to receive an organ. Meanwhile, there are healthy adults wanting to donate, but experience difficulty paying for insurance after their procedure. My bipartisan bill works to protect living organ donors. https://t.co/ohwuH9fqkp

Life-saving organ donations also saves Medicare millions of dollars and cut costs across the health care system, which means it helps meet my goal of delivering better health care to Southwest Washington residents.

Cheers to all my fellow working moms who daily navigate a maze of childcare, trying to keep our kids healthy & balancing competing priorities. As a member of Congress w/ this unique perspective, I work tirelessly to enact the best policies for SW WA https://t.co/BXsNAv1GqV

Our first Labor, Health & Human Svcs Sub. hearing this morning. I raised concerns about increased cost of health care premiums for SW WA & how kids on Medicaid often get overlooked. I'll keep fighting to make sure all families have quality, affordable health care.@HouseAppropsGOP https://t.co/ztDqt1V8fc

As someone focused on improving access to and quality of affordable health care for everyone, I’m eager to continue serving on the @HouseAppropsGOP Labor, Health and Human Services Subcommittee. https://t.co/aIdl5FOnbG
